intro: Leobordea decumbens subsp. rehmannii, commonly known as the Rehmann's leobordea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial that produces small, tubular flowers, typically in shades of yellow or orange. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent, aiding in water retention. It is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
